text: North Korea competed at the 2016 Summer Paralympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, from 7 September to 18 September 2016. == Athletics == Song Kum-jong about to board the bus to attend the Opening Ceremonies of the Rio Games. Two North Korean athletes participated at the Rio Games. One is female discus thrower Song Kum-jong."North Korean Athletes Arrive in Rio for Summer Paralympics", The Korea Bizwire, 5 September 2016 ;Men's Track {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Events !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Final |- !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Kim Chol Ung (Guide – Ri Kum Song) |align=left|1500 m T11 |colspan=2|Disqualified |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ;Women's Field {|class=wikitable style="font- size:90%" |-align=center !Athlete !Events !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Song Kum Jong |align=left|Discus F56-57 |12.08 |12 |} == See also == *North Korea at the 2016 Summer Olympics == References == Category:Nations at the 2016 Summer Paralympics 2016 Category:2016 in North Korean sport
title: North Korea at the 2016 Summer Paralympics
